B Survey Details We repeated our survey across five weekly waves spanning April, 2020: April 1 (N=482), April 8 (N=1,974), April 15 (N=1,027), April 22 (N=988), and April 29 (N=1,029). All surveys included questions on expectations and worries about how the pandemic may affect the health and economic well-being of themselves and others, policy attitudes, and news consumption patterns. Questions on self protective actions were introduced on April 8. Questions about constraints were introduced on April 15; the risk preference assessment was introduced on April 22. The survey is replicated in Supplemental Appendix SC.
